alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 10:52AM EST until January 04 at 3:15PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Cabarrus and Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 AM EST, Heavy runoff will result in developing out of bank conditions throughout the headwaters of the Rocky River. Watch for low spot flooding along such creeks as West Branch, Mallard, and Back into this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntersville, Northeast Charlotte, East Charlotte, West Concord, Mint Hill, Davidson, Harrisburg, University City, Charlotte Motor Speedway and Reedy Creek Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
